Shoreline.Ingraham High School: Ingraham International School is a public high school, serving grades 9–12 in the Haller Lake neighborhood of Seattle, Washington. Opened in 1959, the school is named after Edward Sturgis Ingraham, the first superintendent of the Seattle Public Schools. Since 2002, Ingraham has been an International Baccalaureate school, and also offers programs such as the Academy of Information Technology.
